You're kind of misunderstanding how science works. It is a method (called the scientific method, oddly) to test a hypothesis, which is usually formed from observations. That is not a proof, so science doesn't prove anything one way or another. Mathematics uses proofs, but that's another subject. Science can only test hypotheses that are falsifiable. That is, can you test the positive hypothesis (let's say water freezes at 0º) and the falsifiable hypothesis (water does not freeze at 0º).
